meanings.definition: Lauders (noun): People who praise or admire someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The lauders cheered loudly for the talented singer.
meanings.sent2: The lauders gathered to celebrate the achievements of their favorite author.
meanings.sent3: The group of lauders clapped enthusiastically at the end of the performance.
meanings.sent4: She was surrounded by a circle of lauders showering her with compliments.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the sound of lauders expressing their admiration.

meanings.definition: Lauders (verb): To praise or admire someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She lauders her best friend for always being there for her.
meanings.sent2: The teacher lauders the students who put in extra effort on their projects.
meanings.sent3: He lauders his cat for catching a mouse in the house.
meanings.sent4: The audience lauders the actor's heartfelt performance on stage.
meanings.sent5: The community lauders the volunteers for their selfless dedication to helping others.
